justification: Good acknowledgment of Team B’s conservative style and reluctance to give up their most stable RB, plus noting B’s willingness to hold injured players. However, it mislabels Trevor Martin as a stable WR and overstates B being ‘thin’ at RB. The trade is value-coherent (B upgrades WR significantly) but clashes with B’s floor-first philosophy. Reasoning is balanced but contains factual slips and minor role mismatches.
